python-class-structure_key3: Browse through the Curriculum to teach **Basics of `Python` Programming**
python-class-structure_key15: . We expect you to follow this Class division, to ensure that the sequence of learning is maintained, and a child has an opportunity to come back and attend only those specific classes she had doubts in, or had missed it for whatever reasons.
python-class-structure_key17: Use the first five minutes to understand their learning journey on Meraki, and encourage them to self learn using Live Classes only as an extra help.
python-class-structure_key18: Use the next ten minutes to recapitulate and revise previous topics, and solve their previous queries.
python-class-structure_key19: You can use the second half of the class to share problems for the students to solve. It could be in the form of MCQs, `True` or `False`, Dry Run, or even Questions.
python-class-structure_key20: You can assign some homework or prework a student must do before the next class, such as the next topic they can read/ study and come for in the next class.
python-class-structure_key21: > Keep checking in with the students if they've understood or no in between to ensure its a dialogue and not a monologue. You can try to make it as innovative and interactive as you wish to!
python-class-structure_key22: You can get in touch with the students through
python-class-structure_key26: if you want to be added to more student groups on the Mentor
python-class-structure_key29: Don't fret in case, this is still confusing. **We are here to help**. You can write back to us on the Volunteering email you received from our end, or write to volunteer@navgurukul.org.
python-class-structure_key31: We're glad to have you on this journey of impacting over **One Lakh learners**.
